title: HAND FOR ALL (HOF) landing page hero/header with sections and static imagery

requirements.summary: Create a responsive hero/header that prominently displays the HAND FOR ALL brand, logo text, main title, and tagline.
acceptanceCriteria: The page renders the brand name and logo text prominently at the top of the hero/header area.
The hero includes the exact main title and tagline text with correct capitalization.
Layout is responsive (mobile/desktop) without overlapping or clipped content.

file_operations.description: Create the landing page layout and hero/header content with the exact copy: “HAND FOR ALL”, “HOF - Hand For All”, “Prosthetic Hand Using Soft Robots”, and “Innovating Human Capability with Soft Robotics”. Use shadcn-ui layout primitives (e.g., Card where appropriate) to keep typography and spacing consistent. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure the app loads in dark mode by default (e.g., applying a dark class on the root element) so the hero/header renders with the intended dark background/white text palette.

requirements.summary: Add a Key Features section with six feature items and descriptions, responsive from single-column to grid layout.
acceptanceCriteria: All six feature titles and descriptions are visible and readable on dark background.
Feature content matches the provided text verbatim (English).
On mobile, features stack in a single column; on larger screens they use a multi-column/grid layout.

file_operations.description: Add a “Key Features” section containing all six items verbatim: Natural Movement, Ergonomics, Mechanism, Customization, Impact, Tech Stack (Arduino). Use shadcn-ui Card components to present each feature as a readable card on a dark background. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a visually distinct How It Works section with the provided explanation text.
acceptanceCriteria: The section title “How It Works” is present.
The paragraph text is included verbatim and is readable with adequate line length/spacing.
Section is visually distinct from the hero and key features sections (spacing and/or subtle separators).

file_operations.description: Add a “How It Works” section with the provided paragraph verbatim, using layout spacing and subtle separators (e.g., section padding, divider styles) to make it distinct from adjacent sections.

requirements.summary: Add an Applications section listing the three provided application areas.
acceptanceCriteria: All three application items are displayed as a list or cards.
Text matches exactly, including the “R&D (Research and Development)” formatting.

file_operations.description: Add an “Applications” section displaying the three items exactly: Medical Rehab, Assistive Tech, and R&D (Research and Development). Use shadcn-ui Card components or a styled list to keep visual consistency. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a Contact section that displays the provided email and phone numbers as accessible mailto/tel links.
acceptanceCriteria: Email “Shubhamjrd@gmail.com” is displayed and uses a mailto link.
Both phone numbers are displayed and use tel links.
Contact section is readable on dark background and accessible (proper labels, sufficient contrast).

file_operations.description: Add a “Contact” section showing “Shubhamjrd@gmail.com” as a mailto link and +91 7357473326 / +91 9468086676 as tel links, with clear labels and adequate contrast on the dark background.

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent modern soft-robotics/engineering visual design using dark background, white text, and cyan accents.
acceptanceCriteria: Background is dark charcoal/black; primary text is white; accents are light blue/cyan.
Buttons/links (if present) and section headings use the accent color consistently.
All text meets reasonable contrast for readability on the dark background.

file_operations.description: Define global theme tokens/styles for a dark charcoal/black background, white foreground text, and cyan accent color (aligned with the Tailwind CSS variable-based theme). Ensure headings, links, and interactive states consistently use the cyan accent while preserving contrast.

Ensure all landing page sections use a consistent typography scale, spacing system, and cyan accent styling for headings/links (no blue/purple-dominant theme), keeping readability on the dark background.

requirements.summary: Add three generated static images to appropriate sections and reference them via static paths with responsive behavior and descriptive alt text.
acceptanceCriteria: All three images are present on the page in appropriate sections (hero and supporting sections).
Images are loaded from frontend/public/assets/generated via static paths and do not require backend calls.
Images are responsive (scale down on mobile without distortion) and include descriptive alt text in English.

file_operations.description: Add the generated hero image asset (3D wireframe/render of a translucent cyan-blue prosthetic hand showing internal tubing on a dark background) at the required static path.
Add the generated use-case illustration asset (workshop scene of a man struggling to lift a box with one hand; dark tone with cyan highlights) at the required static path.
Add the generated prototype detail image asset (photo-like silicone prosthetic hand connected to an air pump with visible tubing and wiring) at the required static path.

Wire the static images into the UI using direct references to: frontend/public/assets/generated/hof-hero-hand.dim_1600x900.png (hero), frontend/public/assets/generated/hof-usecase-workshop.dim_1400x900.png (supporting/use-case area), and frontend/public/assets/generated/hof-prototype-detail.dim_1400x900.png (How It Works or supporting detail). Ensure responsive sizing (no distortion) and provide descriptive English alt text for each image.
